resources.string: All the supplies needed for classes including textbooks, pens, notebooks, college merchandise, and more.
This store provides students, faculty, and friends with free clothing and accessories for everyday use, special occasions, interview and work attire.
The Children’s Center provides high quality and affordable child care for children of students, faculty and staff, and the local community.
The Stone Ridge campus Computer lab is on the second floor of Hasbrouck Hall (HAS 220) The Student Lab at the Kingston Center is in room 114.
Discover Lessings meal and snack options on campus, check hours of operation, locations, and specials.
Sign up for SUNY Ulster Alert to receive notifications of weather cancellations and emergencies via email, text message or phone call.
Food and select personal care items for all SUNY Ulster Students, Faculty, and Staff
Find your way around the Kingston Center of SUNY Ulster located at 94 Mary’s Ave., Kingston NY, 12401
Find your way around the Stone Ridge campus located at 491 Cottekill Road, Stone Ridge, NY, 12484
First aid treatment, medical emergency care, blood pressure checks, health information, treatment referrals, immunization requirements and onsite clinics. \nSEN 103
My.sunyulster.edu is our portal where students will find access to email, timely announcements, bills, grades and more. All students should log into the portal and check their email daily.
24-hour campus safety patrols plus escort services, lost & found, parking permits, and ID cards.
Any past or present military members may qualify for special help based on service history. Get a custom plan to succeed.
View and pay your tuition and fees. Set up a payment plan. See your receipt(s) and what you may owe.
Our Net Price Calculator will provide you and your family with an early estimate of the financial aid for which you might qualify.
These faculty are here to advocate, so there’s no need to stress. They’ve helped thousands of students over the years, and can guide you and your family through the financial aid process.
Budget your education’s cost by paying it in easy monthly installments throughout that semester of classes.
Apply for hundreds of scholarships with one application.
Take a look at our thriving arts programs, a rich source of programming for the community.
Take a look at the history of visual artists, musicians, writers, and other creatives that visit our campus each semester.
Looking to join a sports team, or to just come rally for and support our Senators? This is the right place to look!
Pick your passion and join the club! Clubs are formed around all kinds of concepts and subjects, if you don’t see one you like, start your own club at SUNY Ulster.
Help maintain a cooperative relationship among students, faculty, staff, and the outside community and work to ensure that the social needs and responsibilities of students are being met.
Check out what’s happening on campus, get the most out of your time at SUNY Ulster.
Open yourself to opportunities like more transfer options, smaller class sizes and a higher standard of education.
Join other students in diversity celebrations across campus throughout the semester. SUNY Ulster is proud to maintain a welcoming environment to everyone.
Stay up to date on everything SUNY Ulster by checking in here regularly.
Ulster County Office for the Aging
Services to assist Ulster County seniors to be as independent as possible, for as long as possible.
Creating opportunities for quality, healthy and sustainable housing at an affordable price
Provide job seekers services to facilitate their efforts to find employment, training, and the tools to maximize their potential in their search for employment in Ulster county.
serve, assist and protect individuals and families who are vulnerable or in need
Ulster County Department of Health & Mental Health
To prevent illness and ensure their physical, psychological and emotional well–being.
Preventing suicide is a challenge that requires the entire community\'s active engagement and participation. Anyone, at any time, can be at risk of suicide.
resources to help prevent substance abuse and to help people find the services they need to begin a path to recovery.
The region’s leading business advocacy organization providing opportunities and resources to help business grow.
Making the region\'s businesses stronger and on fostering an environment where businesses can prosper.
Mental Health Association of Ulster County
Needed mental health services for children, adults, and families

We advocate for people with any type of disability of any age and economic status to help dispel fears, myths and misconceptions, foster positive attitudes and promote easier integration in all aspects of our community.
CAPS - Center for Academic Planning & Support

Provides a variety of academic support services to help enhance your college success including tutoring, workshops on improving learning and work skills. Computers, WIFI access, and a study area is available.
Provides assistance to students and alumni in making informed career decisions and in conducting a job search.
Get help from short-term counseling for issues involving mental health, alcohol or substance abuse, careers, and life skills
For those with special needs, the disabilities office can provide accommodations.\nVAN 101
The Educational Opportunity Program provides academic support and financial aid to students who show promise for mastering college-level work.

Our academic community values and respects diversity among our students, faculty, and staff who are committed to fostering an academic environment where there is zero tolerance for any and all forms of homophobia and everyone is free to express emotional and sexual preferences.
The Student Handbook contains all policies students must abide by and services to take advantage of as a student
Provides academic, personal, financial, disability and transfer support for those who are from a low income background, first generation college student, or possessing a documented disability.
Take a look at what books you have checked out and when they are due back at DeWitt.
Learn when the campus library opens and closes during the semester.
Call ahead so that you and your study buddies have a set place to prep yourselves. There are several group meeting rooms available for student collaboration.
Get help from a librarian in DeWitt, they offer support for loans, research, formatting and more.
Request a book loan from another library in the country, almost any book can be obtained for you to learn from!
Stay up-to-date on all academic deadlines
Advisors are your ally when it comes to student success. Get advice, choose a program, register for classes, and more.
General guide to the most common career paths of where majors at SUNY Ulster can lead.
COIL - Study with students abroad through technology
COIL allows students to work with counterparts across the world on a number of subjects through technological resources.
Everything SUNY Ulster in one place. Find program curriculum, department personnel, and more.
Search for specific courses for current and future semesters.
Take a look at the major you are enrolled in with the college and see how many classes you’ve taken and have yet to take before you graduate.
Look up contact information for any faculty member.
Apply for the chance to start over at SUNY Ulster after a hiatus from the college (2yr+) with a new GPA.

Learn time management and study skills, including instruction in memorization techniques, note taking, test taking, and reading comprehension. Get help studying or overcoming math and/or test anxiety.
